data.text: A set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened along one side and encased between protective covers.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An e-book or other electronic resource structured like a book.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A printed or written literary work.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: Did you ever finish writing that book?

data.text: A main division of a larger printed or written work.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: a book of the Old Testament.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A volume in which financial or business transactions are recorded.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Financial or business records considered as a group.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: checked the expenditures on the books.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
